Even you and mommy? Rachel comes over, sitting on the side of the bed --
You're thinking about all this because of that place in the woods? Ellie nods. Louis takes a breath, then launches in --
When someone dies... even a cat or a doggie... their body goes into the ground but that doesn’t mean they’re gone forever... OFF Ellie’s confused look --

See, mommy? Ellie! Rachel gasps, trying to form words. She looks to Louis --
How this is happening..?
That place behind the Pet Cemetery where Jud and I buried Church... it’s a special place, Rach. It has power. Rachel glances at Ellie in horror, then back to Louis --
I don't... this can’t be real...

It’s real. It worked with Church, too. It brings things back. Ellie stands in front of Rachel now. Looking down at her mother, majestic and powerful. Somehow alive and dead. Rachel looks at Louis, fear turning to dread --
You moved her body? You took her into the woods?
Of course, I did. How could I not, knowing it would bring her back?  86. Ellie reaches out for her mother. A moan slips out of Rachel’s mouth as Ellie’s hand traces across her cheek.
Aren’t you happy, mom? I missed you. Rachel turns to her dead daughter, voice trembling --

I missed you, too. Rachel stiffens as Ellie moves in to hug her. It’s horrib and awkward. But it’s also her daughter so something melt Gage comes over, trying to soothe his mother, hugging bot Rachel and Ellie. This makes Rachel cry and hug them both Finally, Louis kneels down, wrapping his arms around them The family reunited. As the family hug continues we come around to Ellie’s fac looking over her mother’s shoulder to the dark woods outs Ellie smiles. Her eyes pure black.
Rachel sits on the lid of the toilet, eyes red from cryin We hear Louis knock softly, his voice through the door.
Rachel? Can I come in? The door opens and Louis slips inside, looking down at he
(terrified) I don’t understand. What is going on?
It doesn’t matter. She’s back.
It matters to me. You can’t just say there’s some place in the woods. That’s not good enough! !  87. Louis glances into the hallway, pulling the door closed -
Shhh, okay. Keep your voice down. Louis sits on the edge of the bathtub, taking a deep brea
It’s been like this for hundreds of years. That place has power. As he continues to explain we CUT OUTSIDE THE DOOR --
To find Ellie standing in the shadows, listening to her parents’ voices through the crack in the doorway. After a BEAT, she backs away, turning down the stairs.
Gage eats a cookie as Ellie approaches him from behind.
Want to play a game, Gage?
Okay.
Turn around. Gage turns around, obeying his sister. She takes a cloth napkin and ties it over his eyes like a bandana.
I didn’t like being gone. I like being with you and mom and dad. Gage holds out his hands nervously, trying to balance --
I can’t see.
That’s how the game works. It’s called Marco Polo. Every time you say Marco, I say Polo and then you try to find me. Understand?  88. Gage nods as she steps back. He turns, feeling for her.
Marco. Ellie steps back as Gage takes a step forward.
Polo. GAGE’'S POV from behind the blindfold: we can only see a slice of the room at the top and bottom of the frame.
Marco.
(further away) Polo. Gage moves into the room, feeling with his hands as we --
Rachel has stopped crying now, leaning close to Louis --
You were supposed to be the strong one. A medical doctor. You see death all the time...
It was different with Ellie.
She's changed, Louis. Her skin. I want to remember her like before. Louis sighs closing his eyes. He knows she’s right.
Not just that. Remember what happened with Church. We need to think about Gage. He needs you. This makes Rachel think of something --
Ellie slides backwards around the dining room table as he brother comes into the room, his hands out, feeling his w She has her father’s scalpel in her hand.
Marco. Ellie jumps out of the way, dropping the scalpel on the ground. Gage turns, hearing the noise. Gage turns around, waving his hands.
Marco? GAGE’S POV inside the blindfold: we see Ellie reaching fo something on the ground. She doesn’t answer Gage’s call.
Marco. Marco? An excruciating BEAT inside the blindfold. Then, finally
Polo. Ellie is right in front of him. Gage pulls his blindfold

Got you! Ellie smiles at him. Her hand hidden behind her back. Then her eyes move to something else -- Rachel coming down the stairs. She walks quickly over to Gage, gently pulling him back from Ellie.
Let’s play outside. Get some air.

Ellie plays with Gage on the lawn, chasing and giggling a they roll around in the grass. BEHIND THEM -- Rachel watches from the porch. Her face is blank. Numb.  90. Louis comes out, sitting next to her. After a BEAT --
We'll do it tonight. After dinner. She glances over at him, a glimmer of hope in her eyes.
It was wrong... I’m so sorry... His eyes tear up. Rachel pulls him close, hugging him.
Shhh, okay... it’s gonna be okay. Ellie turns away from Gage on the lawn. Listening to them
(whispering) We'll do it together.
Gage carries silverware behind Louis, carefully placing a fork on each folded napkin as Louis lays out the plates.
That’s it, Gage. One fork for everyone. Ellie enters with a bowl of spaghetti and red sauce.
Bas-getti! Gage tries to reach into the bowl, Ellie lifts it away --
Careful, Gage... it’s hot... Everyone takes their seats.
Should we do our thankful fors? Louis nods at Ellie as they all hold hands.
I’m thankful mommy and Gage came home.  91. She smiles at Rachel.
I’m thankful for bas-getti!
I’m thankful we’re all together. They all look at Rachel. She’s barely able to speak.
I’m thankful... for Ellie... Rachel quickly looks down, not able to continue. Louis breaks the tension by serving up food onto everyone’s pla Ellie just watches Rachel. Studying her.
You're lying.
No, I am thankful. I love you.
(to Louis) You didn’t tell her I was back because you knew she wouldn’t let me stay. She wants me dead again. UNDER THE TABLE we see Ellie holding the scalpel in her h
(to Rachel) I know you’re planning on killing me. I can see it in your face.
Ellie... stop... please...
We're your parents. We will always love you. No matter what --
That’s another lie! The house rumbles as if an earthquake were starting. A picture frame slides down the wall shattering on the grou CLOSE on Ellie’s face, glaring at her mother --  92.
(cold) You chose Gage over me. Rachel doesn’t answer. She can’t. Her ability to speak arrested by the realization they are now suddenly outside
Somehow the family is sitting around the dining room tabl

text: Rachel looks at Louis, terror rising in her throat.
She's doing this... Louis looks around. Wind blowing through the trees. Aspha under his feet. Lane markers stretching out behind them. Gage giggles, banging on his plate --
I like trees! Ellie stands, scalpel by her side as she walks toward Rac
The day of Gage’s party. You saw him in the road and made a choice. Rachel keeps her eyes on Ellie but we notice something el Bright HEADLIGHTS approaching behind her.
We hear the sound of a truck downshifting. The grinding o gears. The bellowing of exhaust. But -- Rachel keeps her eyes on Ellie, shaking her head --
I didn’t choose... I didn’t have time... I just saw Gage there... Louis looks behind Rachel into the oncoming headlights. LOUIS’ POV of the TRUCK barrelling right at them.
When he looks back at Ellie he sees blackness swirling in eyes. For the first time Louis clearly sees her as someth other than his daughter. A monster. Hungry and evil.  93.
Stop... The headlights swallow them up as Ellie stands in front o Rachel, hair blowing in the wind, streaks of swamp water leaking out of her black eyes and down her face. She smil

How does it feel knowing you’re about to die? The scalpel in her hand glints as she moves her arm but - Louis lunges from behind, pulling Ellie down to the table WIDE on the family in the road: table cloth billowing in wind, Louis holding Ellie down by her shoulders. The truck approaching from the side at 70 miles per hour.
CLOSE on Louis’ face --

Stop it, El.... STOP IT!!! He glances over to SEE -- Rachel standing up, crying as the truck races up behind h Ellie slices at Louis’ arm and slides out of his grip. Th truck BLARES its horn. Brakes hiss and squeal as -- Louis dives for Rachel pulling her out of the way.
Louis hits the ground with Rachel in his arms, rolling ou the path of the truck. They turn to look back as --

TABLE IN THE MIDDLE OF THE DARK ROAD

text: REVERSE to Gage’s awestruck face, sitting in his high cha as we HEAR the truck destroying everything in its path. Louis screams, covering Rachel from flying debris as the truck roars past them in a cloud of dust. Then it’s quiet Louis and Rachel open their eyes to SEE --
The house is back to normal. The walls have returned. The table neatly set. Steam wafts off pasta in the bowl.
Everything just the way it was. Louis slowly stands --
That thing is not our daughter. Rachel turns, noticing Gage’s chair sitting empty.
Oh my God, Louis, she took Gage.
Ellie leading Gage up the trail. Gage stumbles along, but he’s frightened. She grips his wrist, pulling him faster.
Where are we going? They pass the PET SEMATARY sign, winding into the woods -
Somewhere special.
I don’t want to go somewhere special. I’m scared. Ellie glance down at her brother, eyes smudged with black
Don’t you want to be with me?
Yes.
We can be together forever. Ellie pulls Gage further up the trail as we --
They Louis and Rachel search the house for Gage and Ellie. look in the basement, kitchen, inside closets.
Go upstairs. I'’11 look outside.  95.
What’s she going to do, Louis? Louis looks at her for a moment, sick with panic --
We'll find him. Go. Louis runs out the front door as Rachel runs upstairs.
Ellie leads Gage down to the edge of the swamp. Fog curls over the black water. She stands there for a moment, eyes closed, breathing in.
When you’re like me you won't be scared anymore. She opens her eyes, glancing at Gage --

I can see in the dark now. You'd like that, wouldn’t you. Ellie pulls her brother to the water, his feet squashing the wet mud. Gage looks over to see something in her hand The glimmer of their father’s SCALPEL.
Ellie walks out into the water, pulling her brother along
I can see so many things now... CLOSE on Gage whispering to himself, building up courage
One... two... three! Gage shoves Ellie and she drops the scalpel. Ellie screams as the blade swirls down into the muddy wat
Gage pulls away, running into the trees as Ellie reaches the shallow water, searching for the knife. BEHIND HER Gage slips away into the trees.  96.

Gage, come back! After a moment, she comes up with the knife in her hand. She turns, listening to the woods for a moment. Then she follows. INT. ELLIE’S ROOM - NIGHT Rachel searches the frantically. Under the bed and in the closet. She moves over to the window, looking out to SEE Jud’s house through the trees.
Jud...
Rachel runs down the driveway, ducking into the trees.
Rachel comes out of the trees in front of Jud’s house. She pauses, looking up at the house. A single light on.
Jud?
Ellie walks through the trees, searching for her brother. She's angry, her eyes appearing black again as she passes through a shaft of moonlight. She pauses, calling out --

Gage, come out! I promise it won't hurt. I don’t want to be alone. She listens for a moment, then keeps walking. The scalpel glimmers in the moonlight by her side as she passes us. She slips away through the trees.  97.
(voice fading) Gage? Please. Where are you? After she’s gone we HOLD for a moment, then -- Gage peeks out from inside some bushes. He slides out fro his hiding place, running back to the trail.
Gage comes running down the trail. In the distance we hea his father calling out for him.
Gage? GAGE? Gage runs down the trail, coming around the bend to FIND Louis running up the trail toward him.
He runs into his daddy’s arms.
You’re safe now. I got you. Louis looks around in the darkness --
Where’s Ellie?
Out there. Gage points to the dark woods. Louis nods, walking quickl back down the trail to the house in the background.
Okay... okay. Let’s get you home.
Louis walks into the silent house holding Gage in his arm The doors are open, the night wind blowing in from outsid
Rach? Rachel, I got Gage. No answer from the house. Louis sees Rachel’s purse on the table and goes over, dig out her car keys.  98.
Come with me, buddy.
Louis puts Gage inside the station wagon, standing him on front seat so Gage can hold the steering wheel and look o
I want you to hide right here until I find mommy, okay? Don’t come out for anyone. Even Ellie. Gage nods.

If you see your sister, I want you to honk. Understand? Gage nods again. He looks scared. Louis steps back closin the door. He presses the key and the car bleeps. Locked. Then he turns and walks off. Heading back into the house.
Rachel pushes open the door to the dark cottage. Taxiderm staring down from dark wood walls. She clicks on a light Empty beers on the table, ashtrays filled with butts.
Jud? It’s Rachel. You home? The house is quiet. Rachel walks across the room into the kitchen. She looks down the hallway to the back bedroom.

Jud? Rachel walks toward the bedroom. No answer. Rachel reaches into the doorway, feeling along the wall for the light. Her fingers find the switch and - CLICK! The bedroom light comes on and we SEE -- Jud’s body lying in a pool of blood. Part of his skull missing. Flies buzz around exposed brain matter. Feeding.
Rachel screams, turning away. Then she remembers somethin  99. There was_a REVOLVER in Jud’s hand.

Rachel forces herself to look again. She slowly moves closer, stepping over sticky blood squirming with maggots She winces, holding her breath as she reaches Jud’s hand, sliding the gun out of his stiff fingers.
Rachel has a flashlight and the revolver. Sweeping the li through the trees as she runs up the trail after Ellie. She's focused and determined. Ready to end this.
Louis stands on the grass, looking out to the woods. We can see the beam of Rachel’s flashlight in the trees.

Rachel walks into the clearing. The moon lights rings of graves from above. She walks around the crooked stones, sweeping her flashli around as she searches for Ellie. The forest is dark and quiet. BEHIND HER we see a SHADOW slipping through the mist. She turns, hearing the grass moving. Small footsteps.
Ellie? Rachel swings the light past us, pointing the gun. After beam passes in front of camera we NOTICE -- Ellie now standing behind her mother. Scalpel in her hand

Biffer. One helluva sniffer. (beat) Kinda liked to bite people, too. Rachel closes her eyes, sensing the girl behind her. Ellie moves closer a few steps, shrouded in moonlight.  100. Almost _a_ ghost.

I’m sorry, El. I should have protected you. I love you. Rachel bites her lip, building up courage and SPINS AROUN BAM!! The bullet hits one of the gravestones. Rachel swin the flashlight to find Ellie but the girl slips away.
Louis pauses in the trail, hearing the gun shot.
Rach? RACH??? Fear fills his veins as he runs faster up the hill.
Rachel moving through the graveyard, swinging the light. A shadow moves in the mist, the sound of grass behind her Rachel turns again, shaking with fear, holding out the gu

Please, El... stop... Rachel moves past a tree and we see a shadow move. She tu the light and catches a glimpse of Ellie darting away. BAM! The bullet zings through the trees. Rachel moves closer, hands shaking as she peers around th tree. More graves and mist. No sign of Ellie. From the darkness we hear a voice --
Please don’t hurt me mommy. The flashlight flickers. Losing power. Rachel turns aroun gripping the gun, lip quivering, losing her resolve --  101.
(whispering to herself) You’re not my daughter.
I’m scared. BACK ON RACHEL as her hand shakes, listening --
Mommy. Rachel freezes. The voice is moving. Getting nearer -- Something is running in the darkness, she spins around as ELLIE LUNGES AT HER MOTHER WITH THE SCALPEL.
Ellie screams as she swings the blade, eyes wild. Rachel screams, falling backwards as the blade cuts her h She drops the gun and the flashlight in the grass.

Rachel hits the ground, clutching her bleeding hand. She hears footsteps in the grass and crawls to the flashlight, grabbing it and swinging around to SEE -- The gun lying in the grass. Ellie running for it. Rachel lunges out, grabbing Ellie’s leg and pulling her t the ground. Ellie kicks at her mother, sliding free. Rachel jumps up, scrambling for the gun but it’s too late Ellie rises up in the curling mist -- POINTING THE REVOLVER AT HER MOTHER.
Rachel is surrounded by graves. Helpless. Facing Ellie.
Ellie. Please... Rachel steps closer, her arms out, begging for mercy --
I love you. A smile curls on Ellie’s lips. Her eyes pure black.
Love you, too, mommy.  102. Ellie slowly squeezes the trigger and BAM!!! The gun goes off as Louis jumps out of the darkness.
He falls away, into the grass. The woods are quiet. Rachel screams, running up to see the bullet hole over hi heart. Louis tries to speak, blood gurgling out his mouth
Louis... oh god, no, please... Rachel drops to her knees, clutching Louis. Her heart bre all over again as his life slips away.
I love... you. His eyes go blank. Rachel screams, clutching him again --

Louis, please... please... Rachel sobs over her husband, broken and shattered. Ellie steps into frame, mist curling around her feet as s points the gun at the back of her mother’s head. But ther something about her mother’s pain, watching her cry... Ellie lowers the gun, stepping closer, leaning down -- CLOSE on Ellie’s lips whispering into Rachel's ear as we
Light spreads through the trees as dew drips off the leav

MOVE IN on the car parked in the driveway. Windows steame Gage lies curled up on the front seat, asleep. As we settle on his sleeping form, suddenly -- TWO HANDS hit the driver’s window. Gage wakes up to SEE -  103. Ellie standing outside the car, smiling at Gage. Gage looks nervous until he sees his mother walking up th lawn. She unlocks the car and reaches in for Gage. Rachel walks over to the front porch, sitting with Gage i her lap. She looks exhausted, gazing out to the woods. A piece of her soul missing. We see her hands -- They're raw with BLISTERS and DIRTY. WIDEN OUT to REVEAL -- Ellie on the grass in front of them. She’s dancing. Happy She moves around the yard, tracing her fingers through th air as she silently runs through her routine. A sound in the woods behind her. Rachel looks up. A SHADOW falls across the lawn in front of Ellie. She sto dancing, looking right up at us. CLOSE on her face for a moment, filled with awe and surpr Then she smiles.
Daddy! CUT TO BLACK.
